I have been thinking about creating a blog for a while to write about my research. Many providers out there are pretty cool to use. For example, wordpress is one that are fairly popular among people of many industries. And i am actually using such a platform (https://bwangecology.wordpress.com/2018/11/24/documentary-of/amp/)

This post is served as a tutorial for building a personal website using Hugo and the Academic theme hosted on Github.

Background

Many website builders analogous to Hugo are out there. Here i choosed Hugo because of its popularity in academia.

Academic theme for Hugo

One of the most popular themes in academia for building a personal website.

Step 1

Have Hugo installed

Get a GitHub account ready and either Git or GitHub installed on your computer.

Step 2

Firstly create two git repositories both remotely:

  1. Fork the Academic Kickstart repository
  2. Create a repository named ‘yourname.github.io’ (replace yourname with your own actual GitHub account name)

Then clone these two repos to your computer locally. Open a terminal and type the following command:

git clone https://github.com/bioatmosphere/academic-kickstart.git My_Website
